description: This intricate dish uses some less well-know Japanese ingredients and super-fresh fish.

For the dressing: 20g/¾oz fresh root ginger, peeled and grated
For the potato: 500g/1lb 2oz potatoes, peeled and cut into a very fine julienne
2 litres/3½ pints oil, for deep frying
For the salad: 100g/3½oz myoga (also known as Japanese ginger), cut in half lengthways and cut into a very fine julienne
For the sea bream: 1 really fresh sea bream, filleted, pin boned and very thinly sliced

serves: Serves 2 as a main course, or 4 as a starter
steps: For the dressing, mix all the grated vegetables together and squeeze out as much liquid as possible using kitchen paper. Add the soy sauce, ponzu sauce, rice vinegar, and grapeseed oil. Season with black pepper and mix well. Store in a lidded container in the fridge.
For the salad, combine the myoga, ginger and shiso green. Chill in iced water until ready to serve.
For the potato, preheat a deep-fat fryer to 180C.
Wash the potatoes very well in ice cold water. Drain the potatoes then mix with the katakuriko and mix well. The potatoes should be in individual pieces and not stuck together.
Deep-fry the potato strips until golden-brown, season with table salt and drain on a plate lined with kitchen paper.
To serve, drain the salad thoroughly and arrange on the plates. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and slices of sea bream. Serve the potatoes alongside.
title: Sea bream with a myoga salad and potatoes
